page.title: 18BROXBOURNEBURY/THE HOUSE
page.content: Original building built in 1059 for Stigand, Archbishop of Canterbury & mentioned in the Domesday Book. Rebuilt in l544 it was altered & largely rebuilt in the l9th century. Red brick with some decorative stonework & many l8th century windows built around a quadrangle, it comprises 3 floors, over 100 rooms & attics. Some chimney stacks & a 1st floor fireplace are l6th century. Since being bought by the Herts. County Council in l946 it has been a Special Day & Boarding School. A ground floor extension of classrooms has been added to the north west wing and a swimming pool built near the school. In early l984 dry rot was discovered which has necessitated replacement of many timbers from cellars to roof. Work continues to restore the building.
